alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 14 at 5:58PM CDT until April 15 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR EASTERN CHASE COUNTY... At 557 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Strong City to 10 miles east of Cottonwood Falls to 8 miles west of Olpe to 13 miles west of Madison, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported quarter size hail in Cottonwood Falls at 555 PM. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Falls, Strong City, Saffordville and Tallgrass Prairie Preserve. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
